page.title: 12ARTS AND CRAFTS
page.content: Mrs. Brenda Alderman Mrs.Alderman has been doing tapestry work for about ten years.She started by becoming involved in making church kneelers, and went on to find out more about creative embroidery. This soon expanded into making a variety of items, using canvasses of differing gauges, and wool and needles of varying thicknesses. She now sells tapestries at local craft exhibitions and is always willing to undertake commissions.Some of her recent work has included bookmarks, needlecases,spectacle cases, door stops, pencil cases, cushions, pictures, foot stools, stools, draughts boards, chess boards,table tops,pin cushions, shoulder bags, church kneelers, mirror cases and boxes.
